responses: medicines you can consume : Insulin ,Amylinomimetic drug,Dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitor, prevention that you must follow :Cut Sugar and Refined Carbs From Your Diet,Work Out Regularly,Drink Water as Your Primary Beverage,Lose Weight If You’re Overweight or Obese,Quit Smoking, Follow a Very-Low-Carb Diet,Watch Portion Sizes,SUGGESTED FOODS ARE:Leafy greens,Avocados,Eggs

responses: You can contact various doctors here for any kind of consultation: 1. https://afyabora.co.ke, 2. https://blissmedicalcentre.com/doctor-consultation, 3. https://www.icliniq.com/en/doctors-by-country/ke/kenya, or you can pay a visit to your local area doctor or family doctor.

patterns: What should I do if I have allergies?
Can you recommend any allergy medicines?
What are the common medicines for allergies?
How can I treat my allergies?
What to take for severe allergies?
I'm allergic to penicillin, what can I take?
What if I'm allergic to a specific medicine?
responses: For allergies, it's always best to consult with a healthcare professional. However, common over-the-counter options include antihistamines like Loratadine (Claritin), Cetirizine (Zyrtec), or Diphenhydramine (Benadryl). Please ensure you read the label and are aware of potential side effects. For severe cases, a doctor may prescribe stronger medication.
If you are allergic to penicillin, alternatives such as erythromycin, azithromycin, or clarithromycin might be prescribed. Always discuss with your healthcare provider before taking any medication.

For people allergic to specific medicines, alternatives are usually available. For example, if you are allergic to penicillin, you might be prescribed macrolides like erythromycin, azithromycin, or cephalosporins. Always consult with a healthcare professional for the best advice.
In case of severe allergies, an epinephrine auto-injector (EpiPen) might be necessary. Make sure to consult with a healthcare provider for appropriate medications and treatments.

patterns: Where can I get my medicine?
Can you suggest where to buy medicine?
I need to refill my prescription, where can I go?
Where can I find a pharmacy?
responses: You can purchase medicines from various online pharmacies. A few recommendations are: 1. https://mydawa.com/my-health-centre/telehealth, 2. https://www.goodlife.co.ke, Alternatively, you can visit local pharmacies in your area. For prescription medicines, make sure you have a valid prescription from a healthcare professional.
